The Valdosta Board of Education officially adopted the VCS Reopening Plan for the 2020-2021 school year on August 11, 2020. Since then we have updated the plan to include the requirement of masks for our students (August 25, 2020).

The health and safety of our students, staff and families is our top priority as we prepare to return to school. The 2020-2021 school year will look much differently for us than our previous years due to the ongoing, ever-changing circumstances surrounding the COVID-19 Pandemic. However, Valdosta City Schools has developed plans to reopen our schools based on guidance from public health officials and state and federal agencies.

Please be reminded that this plan is fluid and will likely and frequently change as information we receive and guidance for the pandemic rapidly evolves.

Click here to download a copy of the plan (https://bit.ly/31MjLBf). And click here to download a printable version of the 2020-2021 amended calendar 9https://bit.ly/3b6mdXc).

CONGRATULATIONS JULIAN GONZALEZ!!!!
Tom and Heidi Gonzalez are proud to announce that their son, Julian Gonzalez, has committed to playing tennis at Belmont Abbey in Belmont, NC. The Belmont Abbey Crusaders participate in the NCAA's Division II athletics program. The Crusaders are members of Conference Carolinas. Julian’s official visit was in February and he immediately loved the campus, culture, and tennis coach, Mike Salomon. Julian is an IB student at VHS and will graduate with Honors. Julian is also the recipient of the Hintemeyer Catholic Leadership Scholarship from Belmont Abbey. Even though Julian’s senior year of playing tennis at VHS was cut short (Covid-19), he is extremely excited about his future in college tennis.

Julian wants to thank his parents, his grandparents – Jim & Mary Netherton, Keith Childree - his tennis coach for past 8 years, and his high school coach, T.J. Gay for all of their love and support.

GHSA
April 21 at 12:35 PM ·

The recent announcement by Governor Kemp to open hair and nail salons, gyms and soon restaurants did not include schools and school gyms which should remain closed until schools are opened and the GHSA has given the "all clear" for activities to resume. I have received numerous calls, emails and texts regarding the governor's comments and school gyms are not the kind of gyms he is referring to. He is referring to Edge, Gold's, Planet Fitness etc. The guidance for GHSA sports and activities and training for these activities is that they are all suspended until further notice. Schools are closed, activities are suspended. You will be contacted the moment this changes.

I realize that you are ready to return, as am I, but I ask for your patience during these unprecedented times. - Dr. Robin Hines, GHSA Executive Director.

Welcome to Wildcat Nation Coach Rush Propst!

After an extensive national search and after much deliberation, Coach Rush Propst has been hired to assume the responsibility of serving as the next head football coach of the Valdosta Wildcats.

Coach Propst is a seven-time state championship coach, having won five titles in Alabama and two in Georgia and has coached in several other title games throughout his tenure as a head coach. Coach Propst has a very impressive winning record, holding several scoring and playoff appearance records in both states.

"Several coaches from different states were interviewed and contacted, but after all meetings and interviews, all boxes were checked by Coach Propst. We are proud and excited to have a coach of his caliber to lead and guide the Wildcats back to national prominence while always doing the best to prepare our young men to be productive citizens, now and in the future," said Dr. William "Todd" Cason, superintendent of Valdosta City Schools.
